name: Prague Marriott Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Date: August 20, 2007
reviews.title: very good location vs irresponsible staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005, traveled on business
reviews.text: Reviewer: Mature couple, Thessaloniki, Greece
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 7 days trip to Prague ( at Marriott Prague). The hotel location is ideal for wandering the historic centre of Prague. Also Metro, tram and a train station (to Kutna Hora) are a block away. Breakfast buffet excellent. Very large rooms especially by European standards. Nice lobby but very expensive bar. CEDAZ mini-bus to airport opposite to hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel
Good for tourists as well as business
reviews.text: The main problem is the reception staff, who, although they try to be polite and friendly, simply say "sorry" when a problem arrises but take no action to solve it. For example, we had reported an early check-in (7 am) and we were assured that we were given a room upon arrival. However, when we arrived we had to wait for several hours to get first a smoking room (we are no smokers) and then a room full of noise because they were maintaining something at the floor above. Every time the answer to my complains was "sorry no other rooms available". Finally, around noon I managed to track down a room myself and indicated it to the reception staff !!. Also, the housekeeping does not comply with 5-star hotel standards (e.g. the proper place for pillows is the bed and not the floor !).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Do visit Celnici restaurant around the corner. Excellent food at reasonable prices. colkovna.cz
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was located a short walk from the main train station and a 10-15 minute walk from the Old Town Square. There was also a metro station a couple of minutes walk from the hotel making everything in Prague easily accessible. The room still had the old beds but was big enough and clean. Porters at the hotel are like vultures looking for tips and generally harrass you rather than assist. We avoided them as much as we could, however the porter that showed us to our room refused to leave the room and coughed and carried on trying to get a tip out of us. Any chance he had of getting a tip disappeared with the routine he performed. Reception staff seemed disinterested and were generally abrupt and at times seemed disinterested. Our reservation made on the Marriott website 8 months before our arrival had not been put on the hotel's reservation system and we were initially told we did not have a reservation. Only after some seaching on the central reservations system did they find our reservation. Breakfast was good and the breakfast staff were polite, friendly and attentive as were the staff looking after the Concierge/Tour Desk in the middle of the foyer. Overall, the hotel was in a good location and was well equipped, however the porters tend to treat you more as a source of cash than a guest and you get the impression that the large number of tourists in Prague has eroded service standards a bit as the hotel is always busy and they aren't really concerned about people visiting again.
reviews.title: Good location, service needs work

likes.disliked: — Aggressive porters and disinterested reception staff

reviews.title: Nice, quiet, and centrally located
reviews.text: I just returned from a 3 day stay (June 25-27) at this property and highly recommend it. The building appears to be new and is in great shape.

reviews.title: Good Value Business Hotel w/ Great Location
reviews.text: The location can't be better, just steps away from the Old City, shopping and plentiful restaurants.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: As a Platinum member in the Marriott Rewards program my wife and I were treated to an upgrade to a suite which contained two bathrooms, a large sitting area and two LCD TV's.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Executive Level lounge was excellent and had a wide variety of breakfast offerings. The evening snacks were quite good and enough to supplant dinner. The lounge staff was excellent, may I add.
reviews.title: Good Choice for Prague Old Town

likes.disliked: — Failure of staff to advise of inexpensive taxi service option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Marriott is steps away from Old Town Square.
reviews.title: Great Location & Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION: Besides the proximity to the Square, the location is so great b/c the airport (Cedaz) van stops directly in front of the hotel every half hour. This basically means that you get a comfortable one-way trip to the airport for under $5 each way!
reviews.title: A very comfortable stay

likes.liked: — The overall comfort and great breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: SERVICE: The concierge was quite helpful with detailed dinner and tour suggestions. They booked us a table at Cowboys Steak House on the terrace which has the best view of Prague. They went out of the way to arrange a direct hotel pickup for a last minute tour we booked.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Business... but a bit pricey!

likes.liked: — Helpfulness of the staff--and personalization of the details!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS: I cannot stand hard beds so I was quite happy when I lay down on the bed and it was on the softer side. We had a basic room (ie no upgrades) yet i found the bathroom and the room itself were quite spacious.
reviews.title: Very nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SUMMARY: I would stay there again in a heartbeat if I return to Prague.
reviews.title: The quietest room ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: Having spent two weekends here in June, I have to add my comments on this excellent hotel. It is in a fantastic location, 100 meters from where the Cedaz bus stops coming from the airport (Price: 90 CK but make sure you get in the right bus - go to the Cedaz desk first, as they also have buses for 470 CK...). The room was great (on the executive floor), relatively large for Europe, with king-sized bed and double comforters: below and on top of you. Lots of storage space for clothing, neutrogena bath products, iron and board, nightly turn-back service, excellent room service and wonderful fitness club. I took advantage of the fitness, jacuzzi and pool daily, found hotel personnel very friendly and helpful. If you book your Prague tours through the concierge, they just add it onto your bill. I highly recommend Thai Massages if you are going to Prague and want to relax after an exhausting day of either work or sightseeing. 5-10 minutes by foot from the hotel is Thai world; very good and reasonably priced which I found via the net before arriving. Check out Praguepost for insiders’ information on Prague. Just downstairs from the hotel is a supermarket (Billa) so you don’t need to buy costly meals if you prefer not to. If you feel like pampering yourself with some beauty treatments, in the shopping center next door is Monet where you can have facials, manicures, pedicures, etc. but they do not speak a lot of English. As for transport to the Airport, I opted for AAA Taxi, ordered in advance for about 400 CK as opposed to 650 CK standing out in front of the hotel . All in all, I had a great time in Prague, loved this Marriott, and will go back very soon! Oh, might I add that I don't truly consider this a full five-star hotel but who cares for the price I paid with Priceline! ($95 per night)
reviews.title: One of the best I've been to in Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: Great staff. Excellent location. Just 10 mins walk to the center of prague's old town. Rooms are very comfortable. There is also and excellent gym located below the hotel that is free to guests.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005
reviews.text: Just returned from Prague where we spent 3 nights at the Marriott. The hotel is terrific, the staff extremely helpful and friendly, and the location is also great - near a subway stop and the city center, but not so close that you get any noise from the street. We stayed on the concierge level and that's definitely the way to go - a good breakfast in the morning, light snacks in the afternoon, drinks, and desserts at night. The rooms are spacious and well designed - and the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in!
reviews.title: Loved the Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for three nights earlier this month and enjoyed every inch of the experience. We pre-arranged the hotel's Mercedes airport transfer service for 890 CZK and were greeted just past the baggage claim by a friendly driver. We pulled up to the sparkling hotel and were welcomed to by a smiling, professional desk clerk.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a spectacular city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Prague Marriott for three nights in September. We were put on the 6th floor and had access to the executive lounge. We were very pleased with our room and the executive lounge for snacks, breakfast and drinks. Our room was very clean and unbelievably quiet! They also have access to a major fitness center. We worked out once and it was fabulous. The concierge was very friendly and helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. We did not run into anyone at the hotel that was not friendly. The location was ideal for Prague-we would definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Marriott in Prague was a very nice hotel. Pretty much in line with what you would expect from a Marriott. We stayed on the executive lounge level and the rooms were nice and spacious. The offerings in the lounge were adequate. The location to Prague's Old Town was very convenient. A quick 10 minute walk to most of the popular sights. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Marriott in Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: My wife, our 24 year old daughter, and I stayed at the Prague Marriott for 3 nights in mid June. It was lovely. Our suite on the 3rd floor and our daughter's room on the 6th "Club" floor were immaculate and comfortable. Front desk service was OK, but not great. Concierge service was, typical for Europe I think, a bit rushed and snobby. The lobby bar was very nice and the food in the hotel restaurant was good. The Executive Lounge was nice with free interent access (which is pricey if used in the rest of the hotel) and decent snacks.
reviews.title: Great Property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is a major draw. Close to Old Town and several good Czech restaurants. (Cheap, hardy food with good Czech beer.)
reviews.title: Great Room, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best deal of the trip was the transfer arranged by the Marriott to and from the airport. Dedicated sedan service with pick up in the terminal for about $40, U.S. The driver spoke enough English to get us to and from teh hotel, which was much more than I can say for my Czech.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Service, Beautiful Hotel

description: The Prague Marriott Hotel is steps from Old Town Square and all major Prague attractions. This upscale hotel in Prague evokes classic European charm and welcomes you with elegant accommodations. Known for first-class service and conference venues, the Prague Marriott Hotel features 1,425 sq meters of conference venue for intimate gatherings or large events alike. Our hotel offers 293 spacious accommodations and 35 suites with safe, 32'' LCD screens and broad band Internet access (for a fee). Stay in shape when you travel to Prague, with the World Class Health Academy. A heaven for relaxation and leisure features swimming pool, sauna, whirlpool and fully equipped fitness gym. Our newly opened Midtown Grill restaurant is offering best steaks in Prague, International and local cuisine and the finest Czech and international wines. Espressamente Illy coffee shop offers authentic Italian coffee. Between meals, enjoy a snack at our Lobby Bar.
